description.narrative:
Saferworld is an independent international organization that works with research, policy development, capacity building and implementation of programs aimed at preventing violence and conflict. Saferworld conducts conflict prevention and peacebuilding work in Africa, the Middle East, Asia and Europe. Currently, Saferworld's geographical focus is on the following countries: Kenya, Somalia / Somaliland, Sudan and South Sudan, Uganda, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Nepal, Syria and Yemen.
By utilizing local knowledge and building on the experiences of conflict-affected individuals and society, Saferworld works to improve and strengthen local, national and international peacebuilding for long-term sustainable development.
Sida has received an application for core support from Saferworld. The proposal is to support Saferworld's new five-year strategic plan (2021-2025) with a total amount of SEK 90 800 000 over three years (1 April 2021 - 31 March 2024), which corresponds to approximately 13% percent of Saferworld's total budget. Part of the support will be earmarked with an average of SEK 5 million per year for the purpose of working with control and against the spread of small and light weapons, as well as compliance with the Arms Trade Treaty. Sida has contributed core support to Saferworld since 2014 and this will thus be a continuation of this collaboration

Saferworld är en oberoende internationell organisation som arbetar med forskning, policyutveckling, kapacitetsbyggande och genomförande av program med syfte att förhindra våld och konflikt. Saferworld bedriver konfliktförebyggande och fredsbyggande arbete i Afrika, Mellanöstern, Asien och Europa. För närvarande är Saferworlds geografiska fokus följande länder: Kenya, Somalia/ Somaliland, Sudan och Sydsudan, Uganda, Kirgizistan, Tadjikistan, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Nepal, Syrien och Yemen.
Genom att tillvarata lokal kunskap och utgå från konfliktdrabbade individers och samhällets erfarenheter arbetar Saferworld för att förbättra och stärka lokalt, nationellt och internationellt fredsbyggande för långsiktig hållbar utveckling.
Sida har mottagit en ansökan om kärnstöd från Saferworld. Förslaget är att stödja Saferworlds nya femåriga strategiska plan (2021- 2025) med ett totalt belopp om 90 800 000 SEK över tre år (1 april 2021 - 31 mars 2024), vilket motsvarar cirka 13% procent av Saferworlds totala budget. En del av stödet kommer att öronmärkas med i genomsnitt 5 MSEK per år för ändamålet att arbeta med kontroll och mot spridning av små och lätta vapen, samt efterlevnad av Vapenhandelsfördraget. Sida har bidragit med kärnstöd till Saferworld sedan 2014 och detta blir därmed en fortsättning på detta samarbete.

To contribute to prevention of violent conflict and strengthen human security, the core support from Sida will, for the period 2021-2023, contribute to the following five interlinked goals set out in Saferworld's Strategic Plan Working in solidarity for a safer world 2021-2025: i) Inclusive peace and justice: Work for conflict transformation and political transitions rooted in equality and justice, and built on inclusive institutions. ii) People-centred security:Drive momentum to put people at the heart of ‘security’ everywhere. iii) Transform gender norms: Transform the gender norms that drive violent conflict and gender-based violence, and support the social empowerment of women and girls. iv) Redesigning international engagement: Challenge the way the international actors and systems engage in conflict-affected places and support local peace builders to redesign the role of aid and development. v) Climate and environmental action; Work with the climate and environmental sector to find urgent solutions to the combined threats of the climate crisis, conflict, and environmental degradation. In addition to the core grant, Sida contribute with additional earmarked funding to expand and strengthen Saferworld's programme on arms control. The overall goal of this work is to reduce uncontrolled spread of small arms and light weapons and the effective realisation of the UN Arms Trade Treaty.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.8 - Broaden and strengthen the participation of developing countries in the institutions of global governance.
16.8 - Utvidga och stärka utvecklingsländernas deltagande i institutionerna för global styrning.

16.a - Strengthen relevant national institutions, including through international cooperation, for building capacity at all levels, in particular in developing countries, to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime.

16.a - Stärka berörda nationella institutioner, bland annat genom internationellt samarbete, i syfte att bygga upp kapacitet på alla nivåer, i synnerhet i utvecklingsländerna, för att förebygga våld och bekämpa terrorism och brottslighet.

title.narrative: Grant agreement between Sida and Saferworld regarding Core support
Decision on contribution Saferworld Core support 2021-2023

description.narrative: Since Sida's agreement with Saferworld entered into force 1 April 2021, and it is yet too early to summarise results from the intervention. However, reporting from Sida's previous core support to Saferworld includes examples of achievements that the present core support will continue to build on. Previous achievements includes broking peace agreement and reducing violence at community level in conflict contexts; support to increased conflict sensitivity among a variety of actors, including humanitarian organisations, that operates in fragile contexts. Saferworld has also influenced policy related to peace and security at national and global levels. Saferworld has a strong record of working with SALW/ ATT (Small Arms and Light Weapons/ Arms Trade Treaty) and plays a leadership role among civil society organisations working on the formal ATT process aiming at influencing policies related to arms export at the EU level, in UK and globally. As examples, Saferworld works to ensure that the global treaty to regulate the arms trade is implemented, and they have been responsible for the technical implementation of the Africa China Europe dialogue, aiming at preventing the diversion of arms and ammunition in Africa.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
